document_content.title: Referral Letter for Further Medical Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Gregson is being referred for evaluation of persistent fatigue, intermittent joint pain, and unexplained weight loss over the past three months. Previous basic investigations have been inconclusive.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: Ms. Gregson has a history of mild asthma, managed with inhalers as needed. No prior history of autoimmune disease. No known drug allergies.

sections.heading: Current Symptoms
sections.content: She reports ongoing fatigue, diffuse joint aches (particularly in her knees and wrists), and a weight loss of approximately 6 kg over three months despite no change in diet or physical activity. She denies fevers, night sweats, or rashes.

sections.heading: Investigations to Date
sections.content: CBC, CMP, and thyroid function tests are within normal limits. Inflammatory markers (ESR/CRP) mildly elevated. ANA and RF pending.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Salbutamol inhaler as needed, daily multivitamin.

sections.heading: Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol use, works as an accountant. No recent travel. Lives with partner, no children.

sections.heading: Referral Request
sections.content: Requesting assessment by Internal Medicine for further diagnostic workup and management recommendations.
